Reviews.Title: “An Excellent out of Town Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOUMTAS
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Grounds in a quiet location out of town - Perfect for Couples - However Car-Hire would be recommended - The Hotel is close to the main Airport a plus - commuting to Rome Central is a pain without transport although there is a good bus service close by which you need to pre-buy tickets for! All round it is a very good Hotel with a good Breakfast - Room Service Food is limited if you do not want to eat out - however acceptable - excellent hygene throughout the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A potentially good hotel, but the room was atrocious.”
Reviews.Author: Steveandchristine
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here, and the room (505) seemed superficially satisfactory, although it was not very clean. I spent time at the bar and the steward was helpful and attentive, when he eventually arrived. I ate with a colleague in the restaurant and enjoyed a pleasant steak and some decent pasta well served by an hospitable waiter who was fluent in English. My nights sleep was spoiled by various factors. The bed was uncomfortable and low, and no clock was provided. Also the plumbing was very noisy whenever a neighbour used their facilities. After a transatlantic flight the ability to see the time easily when half awake is important to me. When I went to use the bathroom I was surprised to find that the shower cubicle, a minute dirty plastic device, was crawling with small black bugs 1-2mm long. They were not put off by the peeling paint obviously! I will be posting the video I shot of these bugs. Overall I think this hotel is poorly placed for a tourist, being 30mins by taxi from the centre, and is a bad deal for business travellers because of the sleep quality.

Reviews.Title: “Ok only if you play tennis”
Reviews.Author: EdoardoJames
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the perfetc venue if you play tennis at the nearby club. Other than that it's an average (and big!) hotel. The restaurant is good, service not bad, rooms are cold in winter. Location is a nightmare as the only way to get into the city is by car or taxi. It is right on the outskirts of Rome and it is a very big and teaffic ridden city. No public transport whatsoever. The road outside is a fast teaffic route and no shops to speak of within walking distance

Reviews.Title: “The actual hotel is great but their staff are thieves.”
Reviews.Author: peace25
Reviews.Content: The breakfast is great with wide selection of tarts, fresh coffee and other breads. The reception workers are extremely nice. My biggest COMPLAINT is that THEIR HOUSE KEEPERS STEAL YOUR MONEY... I came back to my room opened my drawer and instead of having 200 euros they had taken 100 of it. Thinking that since I am American I wouldn't know it was missing. So, if you go make sure you keep all your money with you.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are deceptive”
Reviews.Author: SeanConnery007
Reviews.Content: First appearance it looks quite nice. However, dspite all the rooms being non smoking, the rooms have not been redecorated since having smokers in them. Not to mix my words, they smell of stale cigarettes, badly. They need all the wallpaper, carpets & curtains to be replaced. The staff although friendly & speak good English, weren't very well informed locally. They sent us in the wrong direction to the local pizza house. They said we could catch a bus into town across the road, but the problems was none of the local shops / supermarkets / tobacconist sell bus tickets any more, so we ended up driving to the nearest tube, which if you're not used to crazy Italian drivers can be quite daunting. That said, the beds were comfortable & the rooms cleaned to a good standard. The continental breakfast was poor compared to Hotel Chains like Best Western etc although adequate.

Reviews.Title: “30' by bus and metro to spanish steps”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderPGreece
Reviews.Content: We have a very fond memory of our stay in this hotel. Breakfast was perfect and the area is very green and quiet. The only small problem was the distance from the city center. 30' by public transport in the morning and a taxi (15-20€) at night for the return. We had no problem with that, because we wanted to enjoy the city and not to spend our time in Rome inside a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LakshmiChennai
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my parents in this place during our Europe holiday and I strongly reccomend it as it is very clean, very hospitable and overall the people are very very friendly. Would definitely stay only here if I ever go to Rome again.We did not find it difficult to commute from this place at all. Real value for money. Must add the Buffet breakfast was awesomne, best we have ever had in our entire tour of Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: alison_86
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel in august 2007 and we really liked it! It is quite far out from the centre of rome, you have to get a bus or the subway into the centre, but we found it no problem at all, the public transport system in rome is easy enough to use, and it was nice to come back to a nice quiet hotel to get some sleep! The rooms were a little on the small side but it didn't bother us as we only used the room for sleeping! The staff were lovely, very helpful with info on how to get into the centre of rome, they'll tell you which number buses to get on and where to change etc. The food - breakfast and dinner - was nice, no complaints there. Overall we really liked it and if we ever go back to rome we would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel Unless You Have A Car”
Reviews.Author: SamsonW
Reviews.Content: We stayed her 1 night as we were flying from Ciampino the next morning. We had been travelling in Italy and arrived by train and tried to catch a bus to the hotel as it was situated on a busy road. The hotel was about 500 metres from the train station but on a dual carriageway with no pavements. We managed to catch a bus which tokk us to 500 metres the other side of the hotel and had to walk back along the carriageway (with a pavement part of the way). As there was no restuarant open in the hotel in the evening - we had to walk along the carriageway again to find somewhere to eat. On the subject of food - breakfast was good and ample. We aslo found a small roadside cafe which serve amazing Pizza (walk away from Rome and cross over at the set of lights) Our biggest complaint would be that we decided to book a taxi to get to the airport in the morning. We booked this through reception who told us that it was 15 euros (which we thought was expensive for a 3 mile journey but were happy to pay), as it was our last night in the eurozone, we spend all our money and kept about 25 euros (15 for taxi and 10 for drinks at the airport). When we got the taxi, the driver demanded 20 euros and we argued a bit about it but couldn't stay ther for long as we had a flight to catch. So my advice is... Only stay here is you have a car and if you use a taxi, don't take the receptionists word for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but a shower curtain please”
Reviews.Author: OldTarheel
Reviews.Content: I am writing this because I found travel advisor of some help in planning our trip. I start with the assumption that not everyone's expectations are the same and not every room is alike. The most important thing for my wife and me is that the room be clean and affordable. After all we are only there to sleep after a busy day sight seeing. We were at the Appia Park for three nights on a trip that took us and two other couples to Rome, Florence, Cinque Terre and Venice. The Appia is located on what appears to be a circumferential highway in the suburbs of Rome. There appears to be no zoning in the area with an automobile dealership, shopping center with a furniture store, Grocery Store and very nice houses surrounding it. They have a conference center and expensive restaurant. The included breakfast was great, in fact the best we had in Italy. It included several meats, pastries, croissants, cereals, fruit, juice, fruits, yogurts, coffee, etc. Major complaint was distance from sites in Rome. (But we were aware this would be a factor). We spent 15 + min waiting time on bus to the underground station and a 20 min ride into the city from there. Figure 45 + min during rush hours. On the positive it did allow us a glimpse of everyday life among the locals. Staff was formal and professional. My other concern was the lack of shower curtain. The other two couples did have one though. We have found this to be the case in other trips to Europe. I guess Europeans prefer tub baths to showers. Since there were six of us we arranged limousine service to the hotel prior to the trip and found this a blessing. The driver was very nice and they can be checked out at: [--]. In summary if I were to return again to Rome I would try to find a hotel closer in.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Varus
Reviews.Content: Myself and my wife staye at the Appia Park Hotel in Rome during August 2006 for 1 week. Our stay began with a very nice welcome from a clerk named Allissandro who was extremelly helpful and welcoming...as frequent business traveller I stay in a lot of hotels worldwide and I must say his welcome given that he spoke fluent English was very welcoming. We were directed to our room which was very clean and had everything we needed for our stay. The Hotel was extremely clean and must be commended on it's cleanliness and each morning our room was cleaned and fresh towels placed in our Bathroom. The hotel location is a bit of a trek for those unwilling to use public transport if you are in Rome to see the historical sites. When you leave the jotel entrance you take a left and walk to the second set of traffic lights and cross the road to the Bus stop from here you take the 664 Bus to "Colli Albani" (about a 15min ride depending on traffic conditions) where you go to the Metro Station which is located underground but clearly marked with a RED "M". From here you can take a subway train to "Spagna" which is the Spanish Steps Square. The whole journey once you leave your hotel should take no more than 45mins. WE walked everywhere in rome but we were caught on 2 occassions with the Metro Stations cloaing early...last train is due at 11pm but we found on two occassions that the station closed for maintenenace at 9pm where we had to resort to a taxi ride to the hotel which cost between 18-21euro. One gripe about the hotel was that the breakfast was poor...!! It is a continental breakfast and the quality of the food was poor. Juices consisted of undiluted orange and fruit punch..this would be my only gripe with the hotel but would not prevent me from staying at the Appia Park Hotel, Rome...I would stay here again if I was to visit Rome....

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel. Lovely grounds. Easy to use bus and metro to get to city.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the our stay at the hotel. Staff was pleasant, friendly and very helpful. Rooms were clean. Each morning breakfast was wonderful. We only ate at the hotel one evening and that meal was neutral. The hotel and grounds are very nice, but the neighborhood around is rundown. However, access to the city was good. We used the bus and metro to get there and back.

Reviews.Title: “A great 3 night stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked the Appia Park through the Ryanair website (also the flights - brilliant value). We had looked at many hotels and could not believe how cheap this hotel was, especially as it was classed as a 4* hotel. When we arrived at Ciampino airport it was midnight and we were charged 53 euros to get to the hotel, which was quite expensive for such a short drive (15 euros on the return journey), but we had no choice that time of night. When we arrived at the hotel it looked very impressive. We were given two rooms both in one of the two annexes at the front of the hotel. One room was quite large, very pleasant, carpeted, had a very nice bathroom with bath and shower, but the other one was much smaller, uncarpeted and rather drab with only a shower. We went to the reception and asked for a change of room. The hotel was full that night but they said they would change the room the next day - which they did. The new room was in the main part of the hotel and it was very nice. The hotel looked as if it had been refurbished - new carpets etc. The breakfast was very good and you could eat as much as you wanted to (continental). The receptionists could have been more friendly - they seemed a little offhand, although the rest of the staff were very nice. There is a courtesy bus which took you to the metro. We caught it the first morning, but it did not run for the next 2 mornings. On these mornings we caught the local bus - the bus stop was a few minutes walk from the hotel. The surrounding district is not too great, although we felt quite safe. We would certainly stay at the Appia Park hotel again. We found the Italian people very friendly and very helpful when we required directions. A few tips when visiting Rome. We were there for 3 days and purchased a two-day open top bus ticket (on and off whenever you wanted to - great way to get around Rome). We also purchased a 3 day metro/public bus ticket. Both great value for money. At busy times the metro and public buses were very, very crowded so be prepared to be squashed, but it was quite fun. When visiting St Peters Church obtain a tour guide. We were asked to join a FREE tour which was excellent, and it was free, although we gave him a tip: it was well worth it. The Cistern Chapel is a "must visit" but so are the many other interesting sights in Rome. Try the cafes/restaurants in the back streets. We found a great little restaurant which was "very Italian": the food was excellent and the price very reasonable - 13 euros each for 2 courses (first course a variety of different dishes: also included was a bottle of wine and a bottle of water). Be prepared when visiting some of the public conveniences in Rome, even in the cafes and bars!!! Be very alert when crossing the roads especially on zebra crossings - crazy Visit the Popes blessing held every Wednesday and Sunday - it was a very moving experience. Instead of queuing for tickets (for seats), arrive between 9.00 - 9.30 am and stand at the barrier as near to St Peters as you can get. We had one of the best views of Pope Benedict ever: he passed in front of us to within about 6 - 7 feet. In summary - a great flight with Ryanair: great hotel (both unbelievably cheap): a great city - a most enjoyable city break.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel watch the taxis”
Reviews.Author: arrivesafe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superb, well worth the money. However, it is only 7 Km from Ciampino Airport and the taxi drivers would prefer to take you into Rome 17Km. We were consequently charged 40 euros (£29) for this journey. An absolute rip off, so beware. I also had my wallet stolen to make matters worse. I now know it was stolen by a gypsy girl from Sicily ( They operate in teams ). Many carry babies and some of them are dolls! I was on the Metro (tube) its their best area for pickings. They never get on the train, and have a diversionary tactic to stop you in the doorway, lift your wallet and be away as the doors are closing. Don't ever think that you are smarter than them. You can be as vigilant as imaginable, but they are so clever, well rehearsed, fast and un-noticeable. When I found out I was back at the hotel buying a drink and felt gutted. The hotel manager, Maximilliano was fantastic. Sympathetic and made all the phone calls for me. If you are a victim, save your time and go straight to the Questurdura in Rome city. We got through our stay on a tight budget and asked the hotel to arrange a taxi back to the airport with the instruction to advise the taxi company that I had 20 euros and no more. The guy that came to collect us new of our robbery and charged us 15 euros. What a star. Not all Rome taxi drivers are robbing bastards. Don't be put off we're not. Rome is fantastic and the Appia Park Hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend visit staying at the Appia park Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a visit from Rome having stayed at the Appia Park hotel. The breakfast in the hotel was excellent and sets you up for the day. The hotel was very good and the receptionist provided us with a map and advice of how to get the best out of a short weekend break. Travel from Ciampino to the hotel can be cheap. We arrived around half eight at night. We bought two one euro tickets to get the bus to Anagnina undergorund. After buying another two one euro tickets at the underground we found out that the underground in Rome closes at 9.00pm -presumably in the winter months as we had thought it opened till 11.30pm-we got a bus-MA2-which took us to Colli Albani. From there we got the 664 to the hotel. Normaly you would buy one day (4 euro ) tickets however as it was late at night we managed to get to the hotel for 4 euros for the two of us. Taxis are reluctant to take you from the airport as it is too close a fare to take as well as the large queues you face when coming off the flight. There are not too many restaurants near the hotel however the receptionist told us about a restaurant nearby that was great value and good food. When you come out the hotel you turn left and walk down to the main set of traffic lights. Turn left and 100yrds on the left is the restuarant. On our return to the airport we got the underground to the Termini and found that the airline had an express bus which left close to the Termini. Worth checking to make it easier to get back to the airport. The location of the hotel is a bit far out but the bus service is very good and if you travel before 9.00pm the underground service makes it even easier. I would have no hesitation of going back to the Appia hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Rome in December 2004 and spent 2 nights at the Appia Park Hotel. We arrived by Eurorail at the Stazione Termini, we then took the underground to the nearest metro stop. From the metro stop, we had to hop on the 664 bus that goes along Via Appia Nuova... 5 minutes into the journey and the hotel appears and this is where you get down. The hotel was impressive from the outside. A 3 level hotel with the basement level used for seminars and conferences... the hotel is well equipped for hosting conferences and during our time there, we noticed a few in progress. The hotel rooms are spread out over the ground floor, Floor 1 and Floor 2. We had a nice room on the 1st floor.. the room was spacious, light and clean and there was a balcony (Though you can't open the doors to it), the bed was spacious and there was ample space for at least 2 luggage bags totalling 50kgs. The bathroom was also more than adequate and a heck of a lot better than some of the horrors we encountered elsewhere in Europe. The restaurant was not open on the Saturday night we were there so we set out for the surrounding streets to look for food and the area was nearly bare. The hotel is out in the south-eastern suburbs of Rome and mostly residential. There were hardly any restaurants open but there was a supermarket. There was a little pizzeria which saved u that night. The prices in the supermarket were decent. Don't bother looking for a fast food joint in this locality as you won't find any. The hotel staff were courteous and if we were to return to Rome, we would not choose the Appia Park Hotel ONLY BECAUSE of its poor location. Otherwise, it was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but not in the nicest area”
Reviews.Author: catfromperth
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel but horrible surroundings. the hotel itself is very nive but there was nothing around but a supermarket(which we did find handy), car yards & nothing interesting. the room we had was very spacious & so was the bathroom (the shower was tiny though). the breakfast was also quite good & we ate at the restaurant one of the nights we stayed there & found the food good but the menu selection very limited. to get to the city you have to bus it (close by) then train. location not the best but very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Easy access to Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good quality 4 star hotel just 7km from Ciampino Airport and 8km from Rome City Centre. Hotel has well equipped bedrooms with full facilities including a free safety deposit box. Breakfast is excellent, other meals are of good quality but pricey. Easy access to Rome using bus and metro. Catch the 664 bus just across the road and one minutes walk from the Hotel. 4 stops down the road and you are dropped off at the metro. 10 minutes on the metro and you are in the centre of Rome. Buy your ticket at the Kiosk opposite the Hotel for just 1 euro and this takes you on both the bus and metro. There is a Supermarket, bank and other shops opposite the Hotel and a couple of places to eat. If however, you want a quality meal at a reasonable price then try the La Bottegaccia at Via Al Quarto Miglio. This is just 10 minutes easy walk from the Hotel. Leave the Hotel, turn left and walk down the road until you come to the Bank of Roma. Take the first turning left after the bank and you will find the La Bottegaccia about 200 yards on the right hand side of the road. Other places are in the same area. Watch the Taxi's from the airport, they overcharge. You should pay between 15 and 20 euros for the fare for 2 people and 2 suitcases. I paid 50 coming in ( It was a Sunday but I was still ripped off) but only 15 for the return journey with a Taxi called by the Hotel.
